intro: Juncus maritimus var. biancae, commonly known as the white rush, is a variant of the coastal rush that is characterized by its distinctive white or pale green inflorescence. It is a perennial plant native to coastal regions of North America, often found in salt marshes and tidal areas. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that are typically丛生 (clumped) and can grow up to 1 meter in height. Its leaves are narrow and cylindrical, adapted to withstand saline and wet conditions. The flowers are small and clustered, contributing to its ornamental value in wetland habitats.
